title: West Woods Walking and Cycle Route

images.caption: Wansdyke bluebells. A view along the ancient earthwork facing north-west.

images.title: Picnic site and parking in the West Woods by Doug Lee, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Picnic site and parking in the West Woods

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / West Woods, near Marlborough
images.caption: West Woods. The woods benefit from a number of tracks, paths and bridleways allowing easy access at all times for those reasonably active.

description: This large area of woodland near Marlborough has miles of hard surfaced cycling and walking trails to try. It's nice for an easy family cycle and there are more challenging tracks for mountain bikers. Walkers can also enjoy various waymarked trails and an easy access route. The woods consist of a beautiful plantation of beech trees with carpets of bluebells in the spring. The Wansdyke Path runs through the woods so you could pick this up to continue your exercise. You could also reach the woods from Marlborough by following the Wansdyke Path south west from the town centre for about 2 miles. If you head east from the woods you can visit the expansive Savernake Forest where there's thousands of acres of woodland to explore.
